description: Order a new SSL certificate as a replacement for an existing one expiring soon.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: SSL certificate ordering order action:CREATE - create an SSL certificate ordering orderREPLACE - replace an SSL certificate ordering orderUPDATE - update an SSL certificate ordering order
ID of the order; only relevant if ORDER is REPLACE or UPDATE
Validity period in years; the default is: 1
The certificate signing request (CSR) in base64 encoding line by line
Web server software; required for some products; possible values:APACHESSLAPACHESSLEAYAPACHE2IISOTHER
CSR contact handle; contact data will be used for the creation of a CSR; only relevant if no CSR is provided
CSR contact job title or position within the company
Domain name(s) for which the SSL certificate is ordered; must be the same as the Common Name (CN) plus the Subject Alternative Names (SANs) of the CSR if provided
Domain control validation method; can be DNSZONE, EMAIL, URL; the default is: EMAIL
Email address the domain control validation email is supposed to be sent to; only relevant if the validation method is EMAIL; if omitted the email address of the applicant is used
Private key in PEM format; will be used for the creation of a CSR; only relevant if no CSR is provided
Key length of the private key that will be automatically created; must be between 2048 and 8192; only relevant if no private key and no CSR are provided
If set to 1 a new CSR will be created automatically; otherwise the old CSR will be re-used; only relevant if no CSR is provided
If set to 1 a new private key will be created which will be used for the creation of a new CSR; otherwise the old private key will be re-used; only relevant if no private key and no CSR are provided
Creates the DNS zone necessary for DNS based domain control validation;  only relevant if the validation method is DNSZONE
